channel.title: Compiler Error
channel.description:
Probably a quick explanation, however I'm new to this and need help, not sure if I need code adjustment or specific java version/download.
Compiler code: [code]@ECHO off title Compiler javac -d ./class/ ./*java ECHO Compiled src... pause[/code]
Error: [code]Compiling... javac: file not found: src\sign\*.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @NSrepa NSrepa
item.description:
@NSrepa wrote:

Yeah thank you for your help, at first I literally took it as paste “-classpath” in but yeah change it to this:

@ECHO off title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *java ECHO Compiled src... pause

Works now, Thank You!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“NSrepa, post:3, topic:471863”]Got the same error with this,

@ECHO off title Compiler javac -classpath ./class/ ./*java ECHO Compiled src... pause

do you mean -classpath as in “C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java” ?[/quote]
I think -d is just a split for the files. I’ve never looked up the documentation for it

@echo off
Title Compiler
cd src\
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

That’s my compiler.
It compiles everything in the src folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error
item.dc:creator: @NSrepa NSrepa
item.description:
@NSrepa wrote:

Got the same error with this,

@ECHO off title Compiler javac -classpath ./class/ ./*java ECHO Compiled src... pause

do you mean -classpath as in “C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java” ?

facepalm thanks for time I got it.

@ECHO off title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *java ECHO Compiled src... pause

Read full topic
